translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIf that is your nature,

original: sgrib byed bral ba gsal yin na'ang //üîΩci phyir med pa la med pa'i //
analyzed: sgrib byed bral ba gsal yin na'ang // ci phyir med pa la med pa'i //
translated: then it is clear even when free from obscuring agents,üîΩwhy is the capacity of the collection of causes and conditions

original: tshogs kyi nus pa de rung 'gyur //
analyzed: tshogs kyi nus pa de rung 'gyur //
translated: suitable for that which does not exist?‚Äù

original: sgrib par @342a * //
analyzed: sgrib par @342a * //
translated: Obscurations.üîΩüîΩ

original: byed pa cung zhig kyang mi byed pa nus pa zhes bya ba med do //
analyzed: byed pa cung zhig kyang mi byed pa nus pa zhes bya ba med do //
translated: Nor is there any such thing as a ‚Äúnonobstructive‚Äù entity, which is what you are calling a ‚Äúpotential.‚Äù

original: bral ba yang med pa yin la med pa yang 'bras bu ma yin no zhes brjod zin to //
analyzed: bral ba yang med pa yin la med pa yang 'bras bu ma yin no zhes brjod zin to //
translated: And we have already explained that a nonobstructive entity cannot be a cause, and that a nonentity cannot be a cause.

original: sgra rtag pa'i sgrib par byed pa yang cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yang bshad zin to //
analyzed: sgra rtag pa'i sgrib par byed pa yang cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yang bshad zin to //
translated: And we have already explained that there is no obstruction to the permanence of sound.

original: de bas na sgrib par byed pa la byed pa dag nye bar dgod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na sgrib par byed pa la byed pa dag nye bar dgod par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is only in relation to an obstruction that one can speak of a nonobstruction.

original: de dag ni nus pa med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni nus pa med pa ma yin te /
translated: But these entities are not nonobstructive,

original: de dag gi bya ba med par sgra mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi bya ba med par sgra mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the sound is not perceived when they are not functioning.

original: de bas na de dag gis sgra'i ngo bo yin pa byed par rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de dag gis sgra'i ngo bo yin pa byed par rigs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to say that they produce the sound‚Äôs own nature.

original: de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na /
translated: Otherwise,

original: sgra dang khyad par med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sgra dang khyad par med pa'i phyir //
translated: since they would be no different from the sound,

original: gzhan dag kyang gsal thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang gsal thob par 'gyur //
translated: other things would also be perceived.

original: de bzhin du ni khas len na //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni khas len na //
translated: If you accept that,

original: rgyu rnams kun ni don med nyid //
analyzed: rgyu rnams kun ni don med nyid //
translated: then all causes would be useless.

original: gal te rgyu thams cad dang chos mthun pa can gyi byed pa gsal byed pa dag gis kyang /
analyzed: gal te rgyu thams cad dang chos mthun pa can gyi byed pa gsal byed pa dag gis kyang /
translated: If you say that the cause is the agent that activates the manifest,üîΩ

original: da ni 'bras bu cung zhig kyang byed par mi 'gyur na de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: da ni 'bras bu cung zhig kyang byed par mi 'gyur na de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: If, on the other hand, the manifestation of the activity that is common to all causes is not the effect, then that is not logical.

original: dngos po ni bya ba ma yin pa khyad par can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po ni bya ba ma yin pa khyad par can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the entity is the specific activity.

original: sgrib par byed pa med pa ni 'bras bu nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib par byed pa med pa ni 'bras bu nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because the absence of obstruction is not the effect.

original: de'i shes pa yang dngos po dang 'dra bar grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i shes pa yang dngos po dang 'dra bar grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: And because the cognition of that is established as being like the entity.

original: shes pa la 'ga' zhig byed pa por 'dod na de lta bur gyur pa gzhan dag la yang de ltar 'gyur bar thal ba'i sgo nas thams cad 'bras bu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde bas na don gyi tshogs byed pa por mngon par 'dod pa 'di gsal ba la ma yin zhing bya ba la ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa la 'ga' zhig byed pa por 'dod na de lta bur gyur pa gzhan dag la yang de ltar 'gyur bar thal ba'i sgo nas thams cad 'bras bu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // de bas na don gyi tshogs byed pa por mngon par 'dod pa 'di gsal ba la ma yin zhing bya ba la ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If cognition is asserted to be the agent in some way, then it follows that everything would be the effect because of the consequence that it would be like that for other things.

original: don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, this collection of objects that is asserted to be the agent is meaningless because it is not in the manifest and it is not in the activity.

original: de ltar na phan gdags par bya ba dang phan 'dogs par byed pa can ma yin pa'i 'gro ba 'di byed pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na phan gdags par bya ba dang phan 'dogs par byed pa can ma yin pa'i 'gro ba 'di byed pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, this world, which is not that which is benefited and that which benefits, would be without a cause.

original: sgra rtag pa nyid yin na yang ngo //
analyzed: sgra rtag pa nyid yin na yang ngo //
translated: Even if sound were permanent,

original: ngo shes pa dang yod sbyor sogs //
analyzed: ngo shes pa dang yod sbyor sogs //
translated: it would not be tenable that it is the cause of cognition,üîΩbecause it is not related to the activity of the agent.

original: gang yin sgrub byed 'dod na ni //üîΩdpe med can yin dngos kun ni //
analyzed: gang yin sgrub byed 'dod na ni // dpe med can yin dngos kun ni //
translated: If you assert that the cognition of soundüîΩis the proof of the existence of sound,üîΩthen it would be without an example,

original: skad cig gis ni 'jig phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig gis ni 'jig phyir ro //
translated: because all entities are momentary.

original: dngos po thams cad ni 'jig pa'i rgyu med pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ni 'jig pa'i rgyu med pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because all entities are destroyed without a cause,

original: skad cig mas 'jig pa yin no //
analyzed: skad cig mas 'jig pa yin no //
translated: they are destroyed by momentariness.

original: zhes bshad cing 'chad par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad cing 'chad par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: This is explained and will be explained.

original: gzhan las skye ba can yang yin te /
analyzed: gzhan las skye ba can yang yin te /
translated: They also arise from other,

original: yod pa nyid ni glo bur ba nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa nyid ni glo bur ba nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that existence is adventitious.

original: de bas na ngo shes pa dang yod par sbyor ba la sogs pa 'di'i ni brtan pa'i ngo bo gcig pa can 'ga' zhig la @342b 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ngo shes pa dang yod par sbyor ba la sogs pa 'di'i ni brtan pa'i ngo bo gcig pa can 'ga' zhig la @342b 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the cognition of sound and the application of sound as existent do not occur in relation to something that has a permanent, single nature.

original: sgron ma la sogs pa rang bzhin gzhan dang gzhan du gyur pa can dag la mthong ba'i phyir 'gal ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: sgron ma la sogs pa rang bzhin gzhan dang gzhan du gyur pa can dag la mthong ba'i phyir 'gal ba nyid yin no //
translated: because the lamp and so on are seen to have a different nature from that of the other.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not,

original: skye ba tha dad pa med pa can ni chos mthun pa nyid can du rnam par 'khrul pas sgron ma la sogs pa dag la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba tha dad pa med pa can ni chos mthun pa nyid can du rnam par 'khrul pas sgron ma la sogs pa dag la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the lamp and so on exist, although there is no difference in their production, due to the error of having a common property.

original: skye ba tha dad ces bya ba gang la brten nas brjod pa yin /
analyzed: skye ba tha dad ces bya ba gang la brten nas brjod pa yin /
translated: What is the basis of the expression ‚Äúdifference in production‚Äù?

original: tha dad pa med pa de ni thams cad la snga phyir dpyad par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa de ni thams cad la snga phyir dpyad par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is not different must be examined in terms of earlier and later.

original: gal te de bzhin du tha dad pa yang yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin du tha dad pa yang yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is different in that way,

original: de nyid kyis the tshom yin pa'am bla ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyis the tshom yin pa'am bla ste /
translated: then it is just doubt, or it is worse,

original: the tshom las grub pa ni ma yin no //üîΩgal te tha dad par mthong ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: the tshom las grub pa ni ma yin no // gal te tha dad par mthong ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is not established from doubt.

original: gcig yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gcig yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is one because the difference is not seen,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: no, it is not,

original: shes pa snga phyis yod pa dang med pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa snga phyis yod pa dang med pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir /
translated: because the existence and nonexistence of the earlier and later cognitions are established.

original: rang bzhin tha dad pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin tha dad pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible that they are different by nature.üîΩIf the later consciousnesses arise from the earlier ones, which are proximate causes, they would arise in the same way as the earlier consciousnesses.üîΩIf they do not arise, then the earlier consciousnesses would be able to produce the later ones, even though they are separated by the intervening consciousnesses.

original: gal te phyis 'byung ba'i shes pa sngar rgyu thag nye ba can dag yin na shes pa snga ma dang 'dra bar skye ba nyid du 'gyur la /üîΩmi skye na ni rgyu dang bral ba nyid ston par byed nus pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te phyis 'byung ba'i shes pa sngar rgyu thag nye ba can dag yin na shes pa snga ma dang 'dra bar skye ba nyid du 'gyur la / mi skye na ni rgyu dang bral ba nyid ston par byed nus pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the earlier consciousnesses are not able to produce the later ones, then the later ones would not arise, even though they are not separated by intervening consciousnesses.üîΩIf the earlier consciousnesses are able to produce the later ones, then the later ones would arise, even though they are separated by intervening consciousnesses.

original: nus pa med na yang phyis kyang nus pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir dang / ldan pa nyid yin na ni mi brtan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa med na yang phyis kyang nus pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir dang / ldan pa nyid yin na ni mi brtan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: If the earlier consciousnesses are not able to produce the later ones, then the later ones would not arise, even though they are not separated by intervening consciousnesses.

original: de bas na yod pa'i sbyor ba 'di yin pa de ltar na yang sbyor ba po'i nus pas bskyed pa nyid yin te /üîΩbdag nyid kyi nus pa la de ni nye bar sbyor ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na yod pa'i sbyor ba 'di yin pa de ltar na yang sbyor ba po'i nus pas bskyed pa nyid yin te / bdag nyid kyi nus pa la de ni nye bar sbyor ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: If the earlier consciousnesses are able to produce the later ones, then the later ones would arise, even though they are separated by intervening consciousnesses.üîΩIf the earlier consciousnesses are not able to produce the later ones, then the later ones would not arise, even though they are not separated by intervening consciousnesses.üîΩIf the earlier consciousnesses are able to produce the later ones, then the later ones would arise, even though they are separated by intervening consciousnesses.üîΩIf the earlier consciousnesses are not able to produce the later ones, then the later ones would not arise, even though they are not separated by intervening consciousnesses.üîΩIf the earlier consciousnesses are able to produce the later ones, then the later ones would arise, even though they are separated by intervening consciousnesses.üîΩIf the earlier consciousnesses are not able to produce the later ones, then the later ones would not arise, even though they are not separated by intervening consciousnesses.üîΩIf the earlier consciousnesses are able to produce the later ones, then the later ones would arise, even though they are separated by intervening consciousnesses.

original: sbyor ba zhes bya ba yang rigs mthun pa'i nye bar len pa ltos pa can nam /
analyzed: sbyor ba zhes bya ba yang rigs mthun pa'i nye bar len pa ltos pa can nam /
translated: If the earlier consciousnesses are not able to produce the later ones, then the later ones would not arise, even though they are not separated by intervening consciousnesses.üîΩIf the earlier consciousnesses are able to produce the later ones, then the later ones would arise, even though they are separated by intervening consciousnesses.üîΩIf the earlier consciousnesses are not able to produce the later ones, then the later ones would not arise, even though they are not separated by intervening consciousnesses.üîΩIf the earlier consciousnesses are able to produce the later ones, then

original: ltos pa med pa can 'dod pa sgrub par byed pa la nus pa bskyed pa nyid yin par brjod de /
analyzed: ltos pa med pa can 'dod pa sgrub par byed pa la nus pa bskyed pa nyid yin par brjod de /
translated: The assertion of the existence of a self is a means of establishing a desired conclusion, but it is not a means of establishing a fact.üîΩIt is like the assertion of the existence of a stick, etc.,

original: ste'u la sogs pa'i sbyor ba sbyor ba bzhin dang / las la sogs pa'i sbyor ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ste'u la sogs pa'i sbyor ba sbyor ba bzhin dang / las la sogs pa'i sbyor ba bzhin no //
translated: and it is like the assertion of the existence of an action, etc.

original: mngon sum du gyur ba ngo shes pa ni mngon sum nyid yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum du gyur ba ngo shes pa ni mngon sum nyid yin te /
translated: The recognition of something that is directly perceived is direct perception itself.

original: mngon sum de las brtan pa grub pa yin no snyam du sems pa gang yin pa de yang 'og nas dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: mngon sum de las brtan pa grub pa yin no snyam du sems pa gang yin pa de yang 'og nas dgag par bya'o //
translated: We will refute the idea that something is established by a direct perception that is based on that direct perception.

original: rtags ngan gzhan yang sun dbyung bya //
analyzed: rtags ngan gzhan yang sun dbyung bya //
translated: We will also refute the other bad reasons.

original: gang chos 'ga' zhig kyang rigs mthun pa'i rjes su 'gro ba med de /
analyzed: gang chos 'ga' zhig kyang rigs mthun pa'i rjes su 'gro ba med de /
translated: There is no entity that is homogeneous with another entity,

original: chos thams cad de'i gnas skabs can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbrten par dam bcas pa thams cad kyang ji skad du brjod pa'i rigs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad de'i gnas skabs can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // brten par dam bcas pa thams cad kyang ji skad du brjod pa'i rigs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because all entities are momentary.üîΩWe will also show that all theses that are based on the notion of a permanent entity are contradicted by reason.

original: rtag pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan dag kyang skyon can du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rtag pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan dag kyang skyon can du brjod par bya'o //
translated: We will also show that the other reasons that are offered to prove that entities are permanent are also flawed.

original: blo ni skyes bu'i rten @343a * //
analyzed: blo ni skyes bu'i rten @343a * //
translated: The mind is the support of the person.

original: can min // khas blangs mngon sum grags pa dang // rjes su dpag pas cig car gnod //
analyzed: can min // khas blangs mngon sum grags pa dang // rjes su dpag pas cig car gnod //
translated: and the thesis is contradicted by perception, by what is commonly accepted, and by inference.

original: gal te gsal ba blo yin na ni de'i go rims ngag yin la /
analyzed: gal te gsal ba blo yin na ni de'i go rims ngag yin la /
translated: If the manifestation is the cognition, then the order is the speech.

original: de skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du sgrub par byed na blo rnams ni skyes bu'i yon tan nyid du khas blangs pas 'di'i grub pa'i mtha' la gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du sgrub par byed na blo rnams ni skyes bu'i yon tan nyid du khas blangs pas 'di'i grub pa'i mtha' la gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is established that the order is not made by a person, then the thesis is contradicted, because the cognitions are accepted as the qualities of the person.

original: blo 'di'i ni skyes bur 'grang ba can dang / skyes bu'i yon tan yid la byed pa la sogs pa dag las 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blo 'di'i ni skyes bur 'grang ba can dang / skyes bu'i yon tan yid la byed pa la sogs pa dag las 'gyur ro //
translated: The manifestation of the cognition is from the person, the cause, and from the mental dispositions of the person, such as attention.

original: zhes bya ba gang yin pa de yang mngon sum yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gang yin pa de yang mngon sum yin no //
translated: This is also perception.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i khyad par las 'bras bu zhes bya ba gzhan med de /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i khyad par las 'bras bu zhes bya ba gzhan med de /
translated: There is no other result than the difference between existence and nonexistence.

original: yod pa de yang mngon sum yin zhing mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi med pa yang mngon sum gyi stobs kyis grub pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa de yang mngon sum yin zhing mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi med pa yang mngon sum gyi stobs kyis grub pa yin no //
translated: Existence is perception, and nonexistence, which is characterized by nonapprehension, is established by the power of perception.

original: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained.

original: de nyid kyi phyir blo rnams ni skyes bu'i 'bras bu nyid du rjes su dpag par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir blo rnams ni skyes bu'i 'bras bu nyid du rjes su dpag par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the cognitions are inferred to be the effect of the person,

original: 'di ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rtags can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rtags can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have the mark of concomitance and reverse concomitance.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / yi ge rnams las tha dad pa'i //
analyzed: gzhan yang / yi ge rnams las tha dad pa'i //
translated: The order is also distinct from the letters.

original: go rims kyang gsal dpyad zin to //
analyzed: go rims kyang gsal dpyad zin to //
translated: It has been explained by the analysis of the manifest.

original: de rtog sgro btags yin gyur na //
analyzed: de rtog sgro btags yin gyur na //
translated: If it is a superimposition of imagination,

original: ji ltar skyes min rten can yin //
analyzed: ji ltar skyes min rten can yin //
translated: How is it based on what is not produced?

original: yi ge las tha dad pa can gyi go rims ni gsal ba rnam par dpyad pa'i go rims kyis lan btab zin to //
analyzed: yi ge las tha dad pa can gyi go rims ni gsal ba rnam par dpyad pa'i go rims kyis lan btab zin to //
translated: The order that is distinct from the letters has been answered by the analysis of the order of the manifest.

original: de yang yi ge'i rang bzhin can ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang yi ge'i rang bzhin can ma yin no //
translated: And that is not of the nature of the letters.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin ni rnam par rtog pa de las ma 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin ni rnam par rtog pa de las ma 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of things does not go beyond that imagination.

original: de bas na de'i ngo bo can ma yin pa dag la de'i ngo bor sgro btags par snang ba can gyi blo'i go rims 'di zhes 'khrul bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de bas na de'i ngo bo can ma yin pa dag la de'i ngo bor sgro btags par snang ba can gyi blo'i go rims 'di zhes 'khrul bar 'gyur na /
translated: Therefore, this order of cognition, which appears to superimpose that nature onto those that do not have that nature, would be mistaken.

original: gang yang ji ltar na skyes bus ma byas pa yin te /
analyzed: gang yang ji ltar na skyes bus ma byas pa yin te /
translated: How could it be uncreated?

original: blo'i sgrub par so sor 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo'i sgrub par so sor 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is posited as a particular of cognition.

original: gzhan yang gtan du ba'i rang bzhin 'ga' zhig kyang med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang gtan du ba'i rang bzhin 'ga' zhig kyang med pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, because there is no such thing as an eternal nature,

original: sgra yod pa la gtan du ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra yod pa la gtan du ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: sound, which exists, would not be eternal.

original: de yang rgyu med pa can nam gzhan gyi rgyu can yin par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: de yang rgyu med pa can nam gzhan gyi rgyu can yin par 'gyur grang na /
translated: And that would be causeless or caused by something else.

original: brtag par 'gyur ba dang skyes bu'i byed pa las ma yin no //
analyzed: brtag par 'gyur ba dang skyes bu'i byed pa las ma yin no //
translated: But it is not so, and it is not the product of a person.

original: de bas na skyes bus byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na skyes bus byas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the product of a person.

original: sgra'am dngos po gtan du ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: sgra'am dngos po gtan du ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it understood that sound or an entity is not eternal?

original: 'jig pa yod tsam 'brel pa can //
analyzed: 'jig pa yod tsam 'brel pa can //
translated: Because it is related to the mere presence of destruction,

original: nyid phyir sgra ni mi rtag nyid //
analyzed: nyid phyir sgra ni mi rtag nyid //
translated: sound is impermanent.

original: dngos po rnams kyi 'jig pa @343b ni 'ga' zhig las kyang 'gyur ba ma yin no //üîΩde bas na dngos po'i rang bzhin gyis 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi 'jig pa @343b ni 'ga' zhig las kyang 'gyur ba ma yin no // de bas na dngos po'i rang bzhin gyis 'gyur te /
translated: The destruction of entities does not occur from anything else.üîΩTherefore, it occurs by the nature of the entity itself,

original: dngos po nyid ni rang gi rgyu las de'i chos can du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po nyid ni rang gi rgyu las de'i chos can du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the entity itself arises from its own cause as something that possesses that property.

original: dngos po'i khyad par gyi rang bzhin yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i khyad par gyi rang bzhin yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the nature of a particular entity,

original: de ni 'gog par 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'gog par 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because that is being refuted.

original: de bas ni dngos po tsam gyi rang bzhin gyis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas ni dngos po tsam gyi rang bzhin gyis 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is the nature of mere entity.

original: de bas na sgra'am gzhan yod pa nyid brten pa'i dngos po thams cad ni gtan du ba ma yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: de bas na sgra'am gzhan yod pa nyid brten pa'i dngos po thams cad ni gtan du ba ma yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is established that all entities that exist in dependence on something else are not permanent.

original: grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: grub pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not established,

original: 'jig pa nyid kyi gzhan las skye ba med pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa nyid kyi gzhan las skye ba med pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the non-arising of destruction from another is not established.

original: de ltar na mes shing dang dbyug pas bum pa zhes bya ba 'jig pa'i rgyu dag dngos po rnams la snang zhing /
analyzed: de ltar na mes shing dang dbyug pas bum pa zhes bya ba 'jig pa'i rgyu dag dngos po rnams la snang zhing /
translated: Thus, fire and a stick are seen as the causes of the destruction of wood and a pot, respectively.

original: rgyu dang de dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa yin par smra'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang de dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa yin par smra'o //
translated: And the definition of a cause and its possessor is said to be the conformity with presence and absence.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: snga ma rang gi ngang gis 'gog pa na //
analyzed: snga ma rang gi ngang gis 'gog pa na //
translated: When the prior [entity] ceases by its own nature,

original: khyad par can gyi rkyen la brten nas mi 'dra ba gzhan skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi rkyen la brten nas mi 'dra ba gzhan skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: a different, dissimilar [entity] arises in dependence on a special condition.

original: me shing 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa ni bla ste /
analyzed: me shing 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa ni bla ste /
translated: It is possible that fire is the cause of the destruction of fuel.

original: me las skye ba can gyi 'jig pa de ci shing nyid dam 'on te don gzhan du gyur pa yin na /üîΩme las don gzhan gyur pa dag / skye na 'jig pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: me las skye ba can gyi 'jig pa de ci shing nyid dam 'on te don gzhan du gyur pa yin na / me las don gzhan gyur pa dag / skye na 'jig pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: But is the destruction that arises from fire the fuel itself or is it something else?üîΩIf it is something else,

original: shing ni mthong ba nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: shing ni mthong ba nyid du 'gyur //
translated: then the fuel would be seen, since the destruction that arises from fire is not nonexistent.

original: ci'i phyir don gzhan du gyur pa las don gzhan du gyur pa skye ba yin na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir don gzhan du gyur pa las don gzhan du gyur pa skye ba yin na /
translated: Why is it that something else arises from something else?

original: shing 'jig pa'am mi snang ba zhis bya ba de ltar na shin tu thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shing 'jig pa'am mi snang ba zhis bya ba de ltar na shin tu thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the fuel is destroyed or becomes invisible, then this is a very serious consequence.

original: gal te de yi 'jig yin zhes //
analyzed: gal te de yi 'jig yin zhes //
translated: If you say that it is the destruction of that,

original: gal te don de nyid me las skye ba can gyi shing med pa yin pa de bas na 'di 'jig pa nyid kyi phyir mi snang ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te don de nyid me las skye ba can gyi shing med pa yin pa de bas na 'di 'jig pa nyid kyi phyir mi snang ba yin no zhe na /
translated: if the nonexistence of fuel is that which arises from fire, then because of its destruction, it is invisible.

original: de'i med pa zhes bya ba 'di yin pa ni bla ste /
analyzed: de'i med pa zhes bya ba 'di yin pa ni bla ste /
translated: It is possible that this nonexistence is that.

original: de ltar na yang /
analyzed: de ltar na yang /
translated: But even so,

original: ji ltar gzhan ni gzhan 'jig yin /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan ni gzhan 'jig yin /
translated: how could one thing be the destruction of another?

original: don 'ga' zhig la ming du byas pa tsam gyis shing mi snang ngo zhes bya ba rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don 'ga' zhig la ming du byas pa tsam gyis shing mi snang ngo zhes bya ba rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable to say that the word tree does not appear because of the word only.

original: gzhan ni gzhan gyi 'jig pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni gzhan gyi 'jig pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the destruction of one thing the destruction of another,

original: thal ches pa'i phyir dang / don gzhan du gyur pa nyid kyis dngos por gyur pa de ni de las gzhan pa dag la yang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thal ches pa'i phyir dang / don gzhan du gyur pa nyid kyis dngos por gyur pa de ni de las gzhan pa dag la yang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would be absurd, and because the thing that has become another thing would not be different from that which is not different from it.

original: gal te shing la mes byas pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'jig pa yin gyi thams cad la ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te shing la mes byas pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'jig pa yin gyi thams cad la ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the destruction of a tree is by fire, not of everything,

original: shing la zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa gang yin /
analyzed: shing la zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa gang yin /
translated: what is the connection of the tree?

original: gal te rten dang brten pa'i ngo bo yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rten dang brten pa'i ngo bo yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the relation of support and supported,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩüîΩ

original: de dag ni dgag par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te bskyed par bya ba dang @344a * //
analyzed: de dag ni dgag par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // gal te bskyed par bya ba dang @344a * //
translated: because that is to be refuted.

original: skyed par byed pa'i dngos po yin no zhe na /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i dngos po yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the relation of the produced and the producer,

original: me la zhes bya bas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: me la zhes bya bas ci zhig bya /
translated: what is the point of the word tree?

original: shing nyid las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shing nyid las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises from the tree.

original: gal te de me las ltos pa can las skye ba'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de me las ltos pa can las skye ba'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is no fault because it arises in dependence on the fire,

original: phul du byung ba thob pa med pa can la ltos su ci yod /
analyzed: phul du byung ba thob pa med pa can la ltos su ci yod /
translated: what is there to depend on for one who has not attained excellence?

original: thob na yang shing gzhan skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thob na yang shing gzhan skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is attained, then another tree will arise.

original: 'pho ba'i rgyu med pa can snga ma yang de kho na bzhin du mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'pho ba'i rgyu med pa can snga ma yang de kho na bzhin du mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And the former, which has no cause for transference, will be seen just as it was before.

original: gal te me de nyid las snga ma 'jig pa yin no zhe na //
analyzed: gal te me de nyid las snga ma 'jig pa yin no zhe na //
translated: If you say that the former is destroyed by that very fire,

original: snga ma dang 'di'i 'brel pa gang yin /
analyzed: snga ma dang 'di'i 'brel pa gang yin /
translated: what is the connection between the former and this?

original: de ltar na thal bar 'gyur ba de nyid du thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na thal bar 'gyur ba de nyid du thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the consequence is that there is an infinite regress.

original: de bas na gdon mi za bar 'jig pa dang 'brel par rung ba phyis phul du byung ba nye bar byed pas mes snga na med pa bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na gdon mi za bar 'jig pa dang 'brel par rung ba phyis phul du byung ba nye bar byed pas mes snga na med pa bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because the fire produces the former, which is not present, by the later application of what is suitable to be connected with destruction,

original: snga ma'i gnas skabs can de snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga ma'i gnas skabs can de snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: that which has the former state will appear.

original: shing 'jig pa zhes bya ba yang shing med pa nyid brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: shing 'jig pa zhes bya ba yang shing med pa nyid brjod pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, the so-called destruction of the tree is the expression for the nonexistence of the tree.

original: med pa ni 'bras bu yang ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa ni 'bras bu yang ma yin no //
translated: And the nonexistent is not an effect.

original: de byed pa yang byed pa po nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ltos par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de byed pa yang byed pa po nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ltos par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: And that which is not an agent does not depend on another.

original: zhes bya ba yang bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yang bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained.

original: rang gi ngo bo med pa de las tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo med pa de las tha dad pa yin na /
translated: If it is different from that which lacks intrinsic reality,

original: de las bzlog pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid bsgrub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ji ltar zhig pa zhes bya /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid bsgrub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ji ltar zhig pa zhes bya /
translated: then it would be the opposite of that, the reality of an entity. How could it be called ‚Äúdestruction‚Äù?

original: de bas na gzhan ni gzhan gyi 'jig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gzhan ni gzhan gyi 'jig pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, one thing is not the destruction of another.

original: bla ste ci'i phyir shing mi snang //üîΩdon gzhan 'byung ba dang shing mthong ba 'di la 'gal ba ci yod /
analyzed: bla ste ci'i phyir shing mi snang // don gzhan 'byung ba dang shing mthong ba 'di la 'gal ba ci yod /
translated: But if it is the other, why is the tree not seen?

original: // / bam po dgu pa /
analyzed: // / bam po dgu pa /
translated: What contradiction is there in the appearance of another thing and the seeing of the tree?

original: gal te de gzung phyir na'ang min //
analyzed: gal te de gzung phyir na'ang min //
translated: If it is not because it is apprehended,

original: gang gi phyir des na sgrib byed med //üîΩgal te don gzhan des yongs su gzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir des na sgrib byed med // gal te don gzhan des yongs su gzung ba'i phyir /
translated: then why is it not seen?

original: shing mi snang ba yin na de ni shing la sgrib par byed do zhes bya bar 'thob na /
analyzed: shing mi snang ba yin na de ni shing la sgrib par byed do zhes bya bar 'thob na /
translated: If it is the case that the tree is not seen because it is completely enclosed by that other thing, then it would be the case that it obstructs the tree.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But that is not reasonable.

original: sgrib par byed pa ni mthong ba'i gegs byed par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sgrib par byed pa ni mthong ba'i gegs byed par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The word ‚Äúobstruct‚Äù means to hinder seeing,

original: thogs par byed pa la sogs pa rdzas kyi nus pa dag la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thogs par byed pa la sogs pa rdzas kyi nus pa dag la ni ma yin no //
translated: not to hinder the power of a substance to obstruct, etc.

original: thams cad la gegs byed pa yin na yang de 'di nyid kyis nus pa thams cad nyams pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad la gegs byed pa yin na yang de 'di nyid kyis nus pa thams cad nyams pa'i phyir /
translated: But if it obstructs everything, then because it would destroy all power,

original: rdzas 'jig par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: rdzas 'jig par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: would it not destroy the substance?

original: de la yang me dang 'dra bar thal ba dang / thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang me dang 'dra bar thal ba dang / thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And in that case, the absurd consequence would be that it would be like fire, and there would be an infinite regress.

original: 'di'i thogs par byed pa'i nus pa la sogs pa nyams pa med pa dag gzhan yod pa des ci zhig 'jig par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di'i thogs par byed pa'i nus pa la sogs pa nyams pa med pa dag gzhan yod pa des ci zhig 'jig par 'gyur /
translated: But if the power of obstruction, etc., is not destroyed, what is destroyed by the existence of something else?

original: gal te ma las byung @344b ba can gyi 'jig pa zhes bya bas don gyis yongs su gzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te ma las byung @344b ba can gyi 'jig pa zhes bya bas don gyis yongs su gzung ba'i phyir /
translated: If you say that destruction is produced from the cause of the substance itself,

original: shing ma mthong ba yin na ni /
analyzed: shing ma mthong ba yin na ni /
translated: then if the substance is not seen,

original: skye phyir 'jig pa'i 'jig can 'gyur //
analyzed: skye phyir 'jig pa'i 'jig can 'gyur //
translated: because it is produced, destruction would be without a basis.

original: de phyir shing yang mthong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de phyir shing yang mthong bar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, the substance would be seen.

original: gdon mi za ba skye ba dang ldan pa ni 'jig pa'i sgo nas 'jig par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gdon mi za ba skye ba dang ldan pa ni 'jig pa'i sgo nas 'jig par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: But that which is necessarily produced is destroyed by destruction.

original: 'jig pa de las kyang shing la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa de las kyang shing la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And from that destruction, a tree, etc. is produced.

original: gal te gsod byed bsad pa na //
analyzed: gal te gsod byed bsad pa na //
translated: If the murderer is killed,

original: dper na nag pa yang srin min //
analyzed: dper na nag pa yang srin min //
translated: like a black snake,

original: 'di yang de bzhin yin zhe na //
analyzed: 'di yang de bzhin yin zhe na //
translated: it is the same for him.

original: gsod byed bsad med phyir ma yin //
analyzed: gsod byed bsad med phyir ma yin //
translated: But not because the murderer is not killed.

original: gal te 'jig pa zhig pa yin du zin kyang dngos po phyir thob pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'jig pa zhig pa yin du zin kyang dngos po phyir thob pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if destruction is the passing away of the destroyed thing, the thing does not return.

original: gsod par byed pa bsang du zin kyang des bsad pa'i phyir skye ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gsod par byed pa bsang du zin kyang des bsad pa'i phyir skye ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Even if the murderer is killed, he is not born again because he has killed.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩ

original: gsod par byed pa ni de gsod pa'i byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsod par byed pa ni de gsod pa'i byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the murderer is the cause of the killing.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu med pa dang dbyug pa la sogs pa la log pa na /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu med pa dang dbyug pa la sogs pa la log pa na /
translated: We do not say that when the cause of destruction, a stick, etc. is removed,

original: dngos por 'gyur ro zhes ni mi smra'o //
analyzed: dngos por 'gyur ro zhes ni mi smra'o //
translated: the thing becomes existent again.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What do we say?

original: shin tu dmigs su med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dngos po med pa de log pa na rang bzhin gnas pa las rnam pa gzhan zi yod //
analyzed: shin tu dmigs su med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dngos po med pa de log pa na rang bzhin gnas pa las rnam pa gzhan zi yod //
translated: That non-entity which has the characteristic of being utterly unobservable, when it is reversed, is not like the destruction of a stick, etc.

original: nag pa'i gsod par byed pa 'jig pa dang mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nag pa'i gsod par byed pa 'jig pa dang mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not like the destruction of a stick, etc.

original: 'on ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: dbyug pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dbyug pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: It is like a stick, etc.

original: 'jig pa 'dra ba ni 'di bsad pa yin la /
analyzed: 'jig pa 'dra ba ni 'di bsad pa yin la /
translated: The destruction of this is like the killing of that.

original: de log pa na 'di yang 'byung ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de log pa na 'di yang 'byung ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: When that is reversed, this also occurs.

original: 'jig pa gzhan nyid ma yin na'ang //
analyzed: 'jig pa gzhan nyid ma yin na'ang //
translated: If destruction is not different,

original: shing nyid 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: shing nyid 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur //
translated: then the tree itself would be the destruction.

original: de yod nyid phyir rgyu can min //
analyzed: de yod nyid phyir rgyu can min //
translated: Since it exists, it is not caused.

original: 'di las gzhan pa'i rnam pa'ang med //
analyzed: 'di las gzhan pa'i rnam pa'ang med //
translated: There is no other kind of destruction.

original: shing las 'jig pa don gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid ma yin na de nyid der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shing las 'jig pa don gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid ma yin na de nyid der 'gyur ro //
translated: If destruction is not a different object from the tree, then it would be just that.

original: de yang sngar yod pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de yang sngar yod pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Since it exists previously,

original: 'di la me la sogs pa'i nus pa ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'di la me la sogs pa'i nus pa ci zhig bya /
translated: what function of fire, etc. would there be in this?

original: de bas na de la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir des rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis kyang ltos par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: de bas na de la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir des rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis kyang ltos par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that it is related to the object in any way in order to assist it.

original: 'di'i 'di zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i 'di zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The relation of this to that is not reasonable,

original: de ni phan 'dogs par byed pa'i rgyu can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni phan 'dogs par byed pa'i rgyu can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is due to the cause of assistance.

original: de lta ma yin na thal ches pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbrgyud pas phan 'dogs par byed pa yin na yang /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na thal ches pa'i phyir ro // brgyud pas phan 'dogs par byed pa yin na yang /
translated: If it were not so, it would be absurd.üîΩEven if it assists indirectly,

original: ci phan 'dogs par byed pa don gzhan du gyur pa'am /üîΩ'on te de nyid yin no zhes gdon mi za bar rnam par rtog pa 'di 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: ci phan 'dogs par byed pa don gzhan du gyur pa'am / 'on te de nyid yin no zhes gdon mi za bar rnam par rtog pa 'di 'jug pa yin no //
translated: it is certainly necessary to consider whether the assistance is from something else or from itself.

original: de las don gzhan du @345a * //
analyzed: de las don gzhan du @345a * //
translated: If it is from something else,üîΩthen the relation of this to that is not reasonable, because it is not possible for something to be related to something else if it does not exist.üîΩIf it is not from something else, then assistance is not reasonable, because it is not possible for something to be related to itself.

original: gyur pa nyid yin pa dang / de gzhan ma yin pa nyid ma yin na yang de'i zhes bya ba phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid la sogs pa yang de'i gnas skabs kyis brgal zhing brtag pa yin no //
analyzed: gyur pa nyid yin pa dang / de gzhan ma yin pa nyid ma yin na yang de'i zhes bya ba phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid la sogs pa yang de'i gnas skabs kyis brgal zhing brtag pa yin no //
translated: If it is from something else and not from something else, then the relation of this to that, assistance, etc., are also to be refuted by that circumstance.

original: de bas na yod pa nyid kyi ngo bo ni de nyid las ma 'das pa'i phyir dang / phan 'dogs pa skyes par byed pa'i ngo bo sgrub par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can nyid yin pa'i phyir de dang de ma yin pa byed pa dang bral ba byed pa po ma yin pas na 'ga' zhig gi rgyu ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de bas na yod pa nyid kyi ngo bo ni de nyid las ma 'das pa'i phyir dang / phan 'dogs pa skyes par byed pa'i ngo bo sgrub par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can nyid yin pa'i phyir de dang de ma yin pa byed pa dang bral ba byed pa po ma yin pas na 'ga' zhig gi rgyu ma yin zhing /
translated: Therefore, since the nature of existence does not go beyond that, and since the nature of the producer of benefit is the characteristic of the establishment of the effect, the non-producer is devoid of the activity of being and not being that, and thus is not the cause of anything.

original: rgyu ma yin pa la yang ltos par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa la yang ltos par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: And that which is not a cause is not to be relied upon.

original: de bas na dngos po 'di'i bdag nyid de'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: de bas na dngos po 'di'i bdag nyid de'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the nature of this thing is that.

original: gal te'ang 'jig rgyu med can yin //
analyzed: gal te'ang 'jig rgyu med can yin //
translated: If it is without a cause of destruction,

original: rtag nyid phyir na dngos 'jig dag / lhan cig 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rtag nyid phyir na dngos 'jig dag / lhan cig 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur //
translated: then the destruction of things would be permanent, and it would follow that they would arise simultaneously.

original: gang las me nyid rtag nyid yin //
analyzed: gang las me nyid rtag nyid yin //
translated: From what is fire permanent?

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na gang gis 'jig pa rgyu med pa can yin na yang de gdon mi za bar rtag pa yin pas na dngos po dang 'jig pa de med pa'i mtshan nyid can dag lhan cig 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na gang gis 'jig pa rgyu med pa can yin na yang de gdon mi za bar rtag pa yin pas na dngos po dang 'jig pa de med pa'i mtshan nyid can dag lhan cig 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that were so, then even though cessation would be causeless, since it would be permanent without a doubt, things and their cessation, which have the character of nonexistence, would occur simultaneously.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, that is not so.

original: de la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i chos mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i chos mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not possible for a permanent or impermanent phenomenon to be so.

original: med pa la rnam par rtog pa 'di ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa la rnam par rtog pa 'di ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: This conception of nonexistence is not tenable,

original: de dag ni dngos po'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag ni dngos po'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because those are the intrinsic reality of things.

original: 'jig pa ni ci yang ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa ni ci yang ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because cessation is nothing at all.

original: 'byung ba ni 'ga' zhig dang lhan cig 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'byung ba ni 'ga' zhig dang lhan cig 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Emergence would occur together with something,

original: 'jig pa ni mi 'gyur ba de bas na skyon yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa ni mi 'gyur ba de bas na skyon yod pa ma yin no //
translated: but cessation would not. Therefore there is no error.üîΩIt is not tenable thatüîΩcessation is nonexistent.

original: med la dngos 'jig med nyid kyi //
analyzed: med la dngos 'jig med nyid kyi //
translated: The consequence of nonexistence

original: thal bar 'gyur ba'ang mi rung ste //üîΩgang phyir dngos po 'jig pa yis //
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur ba'ang mi rung ste // gang phyir dngos po 'jig pa yis //
translated: is also untenable.üîΩBecause we do not assert

original: 'jig pa dag ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: 'jig pa dag ni mi 'dod do //
translated: that cessation is the disintegration of things.

original: ji ltar na med pa'i 'jig pas dngos po 'jig par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar na med pa'i 'jig pas dngos po 'jig par 'gyur //
translated: How could a non-existent cessation cause the cessation of a thing?

original: de bas na dngos po 'jig pa can du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na dngos po 'jig pa can du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, a thing would not be subject to cessation.

original: zhes bya ba yang thal bar 'gyur ba nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yang thal bar 'gyur ba nyid ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that the consequence is not accepted,

original: 'jig pa las dngos po zhig pa khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa las dngos po zhig pa khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because we do not accept that a thing ceases due to cessation.

original: 'jig pa zhes bya ba cung zhig kyang med do zhes smra ba gang yin pa de ji ltar de las dngos po zhig par 'dod /
analyzed: 'jig pa zhes bya ba cung zhig kyang med do zhes smra ba gang yin pa de ji ltar de las dngos po zhig par 'dod /
translated: How could one maintain that a thing ceases due to cessation, when one says that there is not the slightest thing called cessation?

original: da ni 'jig pa med pa yin na ji ltar dngos po 'jig pa zhes bya /
analyzed: da ni 'jig pa med pa yin na ji ltar dngos po 'jig pa zhes bya /
translated: Now, if cessation does not exist, how could a thing be subject to cessation?

original: da ltar byung ba'i gnas skabs 'jig pa med pa can 'jig par mi 'gyur /üîΩgang zhig gang gis de dang ldan pa ma yin pa de des de ltar tha snyad 'dogs pa'am /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i gnas skabs 'jig pa med pa can 'jig par mi 'gyur / gang zhig gang gis de dang ldan pa ma yin pa de des de ltar tha snyad 'dogs pa'am /
translated: The present state of existence would not be subject to cessation.

original: shes pa ma yin @345b te /
analyzed: shes pa ma yin @345b te /
translated: One does not designate or cognize that which does not possess that.

original: dper na rta la rvas tha snyad mi 'dogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rta la rvas tha snyad mi 'dogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, one does not designate a horse as having horns.

original: 'jig pa med pa nyid ma yin mod kyi dngos po'i 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig pa med pa nyid ma yin mod kyi dngos po'i 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not that there is no destruction, but that the transformation of a thing does not exist.

original: dngos po'i skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos can 'jig pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos can 'jig pa yin no //
translated: The momentary thing, which has the nature of remaining, is destroyed.

original: 'di'i rang bzhin de dus phyis 'di 'jig par 'gyur ba zhes nges par byas nas ji ltar shes pa bzhin du tha snyad 'dogs par byed do //
analyzed: 'di'i rang bzhin de dus phyis 'di 'jig par 'gyur ba zhes nges par byas nas ji ltar shes pa bzhin du tha snyad 'dogs par byed do //
translated: Having ascertained that its nature is such that it is destroyed later, one makes a conventional designation in accordance with one‚Äôs knowledge.

original: zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to //
translated: This has been explained.

original: dngos po cung zhig kyang 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po cung zhig kyang 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: A thing does not transform into something else at any time.

original: 'on kyang de nyid rang gi rgyu dag las de lta bur 'jig pa dag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang de nyid rang gi rgyu dag las de lta bur 'jig pa dag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: However, it is just that, in that way, it is destroyed by its own causes.

original: de bas yod pa nyid 'ga' zhig gis kyang de zhig pha ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas yod pa nyid 'ga' zhig gis kyang de zhig pha ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not that something existent is destroyed by something else.

original: 'on ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on ci yin zhe na /
translated: But what is it?

original: de'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said to be its own nature.

original: 'o na da ji ltar na 'jig pa rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ro zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na da ji ltar na 'jig pa rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ro zhes brjod ce na /
translated: But how can it be said that destruction is without a cause?

original: dngos 'jig gzhan la ltos med phyir //
analyzed: dngos 'jig gzhan la ltos med phyir //
translated: Because the destruction of a thing does not depend on another.

original: de shes phyir na sems kyis ni //
analyzed: de shes phyir na sems kyis ni //
translated: In order to understand that, the mind

original: de yi tha snyad sgro btags nas //
analyzed: de yi tha snyad sgro btags nas //
translated: Ascribes the convention of ‚Äúcessation‚Äù

original: gnas skabs de rgyu med can bshad //
analyzed: gnas skabs de rgyu med can bshad //
translated: To the state that is without a cause.

original: dngos po skyes pa gzhan las 'jig pa thob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po skyes pa gzhan las 'jig pa thob pa ma yin no //
translated: An entity that has arisen does not come to cease due to another.

original: de lta bur gyur pa nyid rang nyid skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa nyid rang nyid skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it itself has arisen in just that way.

original: de ltar na gzhan la ltos pa'i chos gzhan dgag pa'i phyir dang / de'i rang bzhin shes pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de ltar na gzhan la ltos pa'i chos gzhan dgag pa'i phyir dang / de'i rang bzhin shes pa'i phyir //
translated: Thus, in order to refute the other that is dependent on the other, and in order to understand its nature,

original: sems kyis chos can las chos don gzhan du gyur pa bzhin du rnam par phye nas /
analyzed: sems kyis chos can las chos don gzhan du gyur pa bzhin du rnam par phye nas /
translated: The mind distinguishes the property from the property-possessor, as if they were different things.

original: de tsam shes par 'dod pa'i tshe rang bzhin nyid la de skad brjod do //
analyzed: de tsam shes par 'dod pa'i tshe rang bzhin nyid la de skad brjod do //
translated: When one wishes to understand that much, one speaks in that way about the nature itself.

original: 'ga' zhig tu de ltar mthong ba las sgra tsam nyid kyis 'khrul pa'i blo dman pa dag gis de dang de 'jig pa'i yon tan dang de'i yod pa dang rgyu dang bcas pa can yin nam /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu de ltar mthong ba las sgra tsam nyid kyis 'khrul pa'i blo dman pa dag gis de dang de 'jig pa'i yon tan dang de'i yod pa dang rgyu dang bcas pa can yin nam /
translated: Some see it that way. But due to the mere sound of the words, those with inferior minds who are confused think, ‚ÄúIs it the quality of that which ceases, and does it have existence and a cause?

original: rgyu med pa can du sgro btags nas de kho na nyid la gnas pa med pa can gyis dngos po dpyod pas bdag nyid 'khrug par byed de //
analyzed: rgyu med pa can du sgro btags nas de kho na nyid la gnas pa med pa can gyis dngos po dpyod pas bdag nyid 'khrug par byed de //
translated: Having imputed it to be causeless, those who are devoid of abiding in reality, by analyzing entities, disturb themselves.

original: gal te med par rang nyid kyis //
analyzed: gal te med par rang nyid kyis //
translated: If nonexistence itself existed,

original: yod na 'ang rnam rtog 'di mtshungs so //
analyzed: yod na 'ang rnam rtog 'di mtshungs so //
translated: this conception would be the same.

original: gzhan las 'byung ba nyid ma yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: gzhan las 'byung ba nyid ma yin du zin kyang /
translated: Even if it were not the case that destruction arises from another,

original: dngos po'i 'jig pa rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa yin na /
analyzed: dngos po'i 'jig pa rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa yin na /
translated: if the destruction of a thing existed by way of its own intrinsic reality,

original: de nyid dang gzhan nyid du rnam par rtog pa 'di mtshungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan nyid du rnam par rtog pa 'di mtshungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: isn‚Äôt this conception of it being the same as or different from itself the same?

original: de'i tshe yang don gzhan 'byung ba na dngos po ci'i phyir mi snang /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang don gzhan 'byung ba na dngos po ci'i phyir mi snang /
translated: At that time, when another object arises, why wouldn‚Äôt the thing appear?

original: de na gzhan nyid ma yin na yang de nyid de yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de na gzhan nyid ma yin na yang de nyid de yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not different from that, it would be that itself.

original: de bas na 'di'i skye ba cung zad @346a * //
analyzed: de bas na 'di'i skye ba cung zad @346a * //
translated: Therefore, if it has no arising whatsoever,

original: kyang med pa de ltar na ji ltar 'jig pa zhes bya ba yin /
analyzed: kyang med pa de ltar na ji ltar 'jig pa zhes bya ba yin /
translated: how could it be called ‚Äúdestruction‚Äù?

original: 'di di'i cung zad 'gyur ba med //
analyzed: 'di di'i cung zad 'gyur ba med //
translated: It does not change in the slightest,

original: 'on kyang 'gyur ba med pa nyid //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'gyur ba med pa nyid //
translated: but it is unchanging.

original: ces bshad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: ces bshad pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt that what was explained?

original: 'di ni dngos po'i 'jig pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ni dngos po'i 'jig pa'am /
translated: We do not say that the destruction of an entity is

original: gzhan 'ga' zhig tu 'gyur ro //üîΩzhes ni mi smra'o //
analyzed: gzhan 'ga' zhig tu 'gyur ro // zhes ni mi smra'o //
translated: a transformation into something else.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What do we say?

original: de nyid dngos por 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid dngos por 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: We say that the entity itself does not become something else.

original: gal te 'ga' zhig dngos por brjod na 'dis dngos po ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig dngos por brjod na 'dis dngos po ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is said that something is an entity, then it does not cease to be an entity.

original: de ltar na dngos po ldog pa'i skabs su skabs ma yin pa nyid bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po ldog pa'i skabs su skabs ma yin pa nyid bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, when the occasion is the cessation of an entity, it would be inappropriate to speak of it.

original: 'ga' zhig 'byung bas dngos po 'jig pa zhes bya ba ma yin la /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig 'byung bas dngos po 'jig pa zhes bya ba ma yin la /
translated: We do not say that the destruction of an entity is due to the occurrence of something else.

original: gang gi tshe bdag nyid yod pa med pa de'i tshe 'jig pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag nyid yod pa med pa de'i tshe 'jig pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: When it does not exist by itself, then it is said to be destroyed.

original: yod pa med pa zhes bya ba de ni med par dgag pa yin gyi ma yin par dgag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa med pa zhes bya ba de ni med par dgag pa yin gyi ma yin par dgag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The expression ‚Äúthe nonexistence of what existed‚Äù is an external negation, not an internal negation.

original: 'di la yang 'ga' zhig bsgrubs na med pa dang ma yin par dgag pa dag gi ngo bo tha dad pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yang 'ga' zhig bsgrubs na med pa dang ma yin par dgag pa dag gi ngo bo tha dad pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: If something is established in this context, then there would be no difference between an external negation and an internal negation.

original: gnyi ga la yang sgrub pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang sgrub pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In both cases, the establishment of something is primary.

original: de ltar na 'ga' zhig kyang dgag pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na 'ga' zhig kyang dgag pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, since there is no negation of anything whatsoever,

original: 'ga' zhig tu yang ma yin par dgag par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu yang ma yin par dgag par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: there is no negation of anything whatsoever.

original: gal te 'ga' zhig las ldog par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig las ldog par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: If there were a negation of something,

original: de las bzlog pa de ma yin par dgag pa la reg par 'gyur na yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa de ma yin par dgag pa la reg par 'gyur na yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: then there would be a negation of that which is not that, but that does not exist.

original: thams cad du log par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa na dngos po 'ga' zhig rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du log par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa na dngos po 'ga' zhig rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is said that ‚Äúthere is a negation of everything,‚Äù then something would be understood.

original: de ltar 'di ni don gzhan yod pa nyid bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'di ni don gzhan yod pa nyid bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, this would demonstrate the existence of another object.

original: de dag ni phan tshun tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: de dag ni phan tshun tha dad pa med do //
translated: They are not mutually different.

original: tha dad pa med na yang ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa med na yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor are they not different.

original: de ltar log pa med pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar log pa med pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, since there is no negation, there is no positive concomitance,

original: de ni gcig gi rang bzhin la gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gcig gi rang bzhin la gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is characterized by the nature of being one.

original: gnas pa de yang de las gzhan ldog pa na yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas pa de yang de las gzhan ldog pa na yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: And that which abides would exist when it is negated as different from that.

original: de yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'gro ba'i 'jug pa dang ldog pa med pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'gro ba'i 'jug pa dang ldog pa med pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it does not exist, there would be no engagement or disengagement of the world.

original: de bas na gang 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pas de bdag nyid yod pa med do zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na gang 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pas de bdag nyid yod pa med do zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since it is said that it perishes, it is explained that it does not exist by itself.

original: sgra mtshungs pa'i phyir yul gzhan la mthong ba'i bya ba thams cad la sbyar bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra mtshungs pa'i phyir yul gzhan la mthong ba'i bya ba thams cad la sbyar bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Because of the similarity of the word, it is not reasonable to apply the act of seeing to all things in another place.

original: bong bu zhes ming du byas las mi la bong bu'i chos kyang sbyar bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bong bu zhes ming du byas las mi la bong bu'i chos kyang sbyar bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Just because the name ‚Äúdonkey‚Äù is used, the qualities of a donkey should not be applied to a man.

original: de ltar na nag pa'i bu zhes bya ba 'di la mthong ba'i bya ba 'jig pa la'ang sbyar bar bya ba ma yin te 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na nag pa'i bu zhes bya ba 'di la mthong ba'i bya ba 'jig pa la'ang sbyar bar bya ba ma yin te 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, in this expression ‚Äúthe son of NƒÅga,‚Äù the act of seeing should not be applied to the destruction of the self, because it is contradictory.

original: de skad du brjod @346b pa'i dgongs pa yang bstan zin to //
analyzed: de skad du brjod @346b pa'i dgongs pa yang bstan zin to //
translated: The intention of that statement has already been explained.

original: de'i phyir / yod la rnam rtog der 'gyur te //
analyzed: de'i phyir / yod la rnam rtog der 'gyur te //
translated: Therefore: The conception would be of an existent,

original: bya ba dngos dang 'brel phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba dngos dang 'brel phyir ro //
translated: Because the act is related to the thing.

original: yod pa ni gdon mi za bar skye ba dang ldan pa la rag las pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ni gdon mi za bar skye ba dang ldan pa la rag las pa yin no //
translated: Existence is certainly dependent on possession of arising.

original: de yang rang bzhin nyid yin te /
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin nyid yin te /
translated: And that is intrinsic nature.

original: rang bzhin med pa ni bya ba 'ga' zhig dang yang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa ni bya ba 'ga' zhig dang yang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For that which lacks intrinsic nature is not related to any activity whatsoever.

original: bya ba zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i rang bzhin du skyed par byed pa yin na de rang bzhin med par ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: bya ba zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i rang bzhin du skyed par byed pa yin na de rang bzhin med par ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: ‚Äú Activity‚Äù means that which produces such an intrinsic nature. How could that be without intrinsic nature?

original: da ni ri bong gi rva med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji ltar tha snyad du byed pa yin /
analyzed: da ni ri bong gi rva med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji ltar tha snyad du byed pa yin /
translated: Now, how can one make a conventional expression such as ‚ÄúThe rabbit‚Äôs horns do not exist‚Äù?

original: ri bong gi rva ni cung zad yod do zhes mi brjod kyi /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva ni cung zad yod do zhes mi brjod kyi /
translated: One does not say that the rabbit‚Äôs horns exist a little.

original: 'on kyang 'di ltar 'di med do zhes yod pa 'gog par byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di ltar 'di med do zhes yod pa 'gog par byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: However, one does deny their existence by saying, ‚ÄúThey do not exist.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis tha snyad 'dogs pa pos de 'di ltar bya ba dang ldan pa bzhin du sgro btags nas ston par byed kyi de ni de ltar ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis tha snyad 'dogs pa pos de 'di ltar bya ba dang ldan pa bzhin du sgro btags nas ston par byed kyi de ni de ltar ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, the one who makes the conventional expression, in some way, attributes activity to it and teaches that it is as if it existed, but it is not like that.

original: de la de kho na nyid ni don thams cad kyis dben pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de la de kho na nyid ni don thams cad kyis dben pa yin gyi /
translated: Reality is the absence of all objects.

original: ngo bo 'ga' zhig dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo 'ga' zhig dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not endowed with any nature.

original: de lta bu'i 'jig pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i 'jig pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not non-existence,

original: dngos po ni de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po ni de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because an entity is its nature.

original: gal te 'chad pa po dag gis de skad du de yang bshad kyi bdag nyid ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'chad pa po dag gis de skad du de yang bshad kyi bdag nyid ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: If the expounders say that, but it is not so in reality,

original: de'i tshe cung zhig tu yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'dod pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe cung zhig tu yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'dod pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: then it would not be anything at all.

original: de bas na bdag nyid dngos po'i rang bzhin la de nyid dang gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis las 'das pa ma yin na /
analyzed: de bas na bdag nyid dngos po'i rang bzhin la de nyid dang gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis las 'das pa ma yin na /
translated: Thus, if the nature of an entity is not beyond the two conceptual thoughts of sameness and difference,

original: de kho na nyid ma yin pa'i rang bzhin ni gzhan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ma yin pa'i rang bzhin ni gzhan nyid yin no //
translated: then it is not reality.

original: gzugs dang ro dag kyang phan tshun gzhan nyid du gyur pa ni gzhan nyid ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang ro dag kyang phan tshun gzhan nyid du gyur pa ni gzhan nyid ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: Form and taste, which are different from each other, are not different.

original: gal te rang bzhin la rag lus pa med pa ni gzhan nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin la rag lus pa med pa ni gzhan nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the otherness of something is its lack of dependence on a nature,

original: rag lus pa zhes bya ba 'di gang yin /
analyzed: rag lus pa zhes bya ba 'di gang yin /
translated: what is this so-called dependence?

original: gang gis der yang mi 'gyur ba dang / rang bzhin gzhan du'ang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis der yang mi 'gyur ba dang / rang bzhin gzhan du'ang mi 'gyur /
translated: Because of which, it would not be that, and its nature would not change.

original: gal te skye ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te skye ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is arising,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu thams cad phan tshun brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu thams cad phan tshun brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then all causes and effects would not be mutually expressible.

original: de ltar na thams cad la thams cad rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir 'ga' zhig kyang gzhan du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na thams cad la thams cad rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir 'ga' zhig kyang gzhan du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, because everything is connected to everything else in some way, nothing would change into anything else.

original: 'dis brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin pa de ltar na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid sgra gzhan gyis bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin pa de ltar na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid sgra gzhan gyis bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though this is not expressible in this way, the nature of cause and effect is indicated by other terms.

original: don gzhan tha dad pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don gzhan tha dad pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not a different object that is different.

original: rang bzhin gyi rjes su 'gro ba nyid ma @347a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi rjes su 'gro ba nyid ma @347a * //
translated: It is not the case that it follows a nature.

original: yin pa nyid gzhan nyid yin par smra'o //
analyzed: yin pa nyid gzhan nyid yin par smra'o //
translated: It is said that otherness is not being that.

original: de yang rang bzhin dang ldan pa gzhan dang gzhan du yod pa de ltar na gzhan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin dang ldan pa gzhan dang gzhan du yod pa de ltar na gzhan nyid yin no //
translated: Moreover, if it were to exist as something different that possesses a nature, then it would be different.

original: de'i skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi rag las pa las rag lus pa gzhan yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi rag las pa las rag lus pa gzhan yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But apart from the nature that is characterized by arising, there is no other dependence that is dependent.

original: rag lus pa med pa'i 'khrul pa la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rag lus pa med pa'i 'khrul pa la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no contradiction in error that lacks dependence.

original: de dang chos tha dad pas gzhan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de dang chos tha dad pas gzhan nyid yin no //
translated: It is different because it is a different property.

original: gal te shes pas byas pa'i rag lus pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te shes pas byas pa'i rag lus pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is dependence that is created by consciousness,

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na gang rtogs pa med na mi 'byung ba'i shes pa gang yin pa des rtogs pa la nges par de snang ba'i phyir de de'i ngo bo ma yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na gang rtogs pa med na mi 'byung ba'i shes pa gang yin pa des rtogs pa la nges par de snang ba'i phyir de de'i ngo bo ma yin du zin kyang /
translated: then it would be so, because that which is not realized does not occur, and that which is realized by consciousness is definitely perceived in it. Therefore, even though it is not its nature,

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: it is not to be expressed.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: de ni bdag nyid rang med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bdag nyid rang med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is itself nonexistent.

original: de nyid ni snang ba gang yin pa de'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni snang ba gang yin pa de'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: That which is perceived is the nature of that.

original: rang bzhin dang ldan pa nyid yin na 'di de dang 'dra bar snang bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang ldan pa nyid yin na 'di de dang 'dra bar snang bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: If it is endowed with a nature, then it follows that it would appear as such.

original: snang du rung ba mi snang na ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang du rung ba mi snang na ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is suitable to appear but does not appear, then it does not exist.

original: mi snang ba nyid yin na yang de'i ngo bo shes pa ma yin pa de ltar na gang gang la rag lus pa shes pa yin /
analyzed: mi snang ba nyid yin na yang de'i ngo bo shes pa ma yin pa de ltar na gang gang la rag lus pa shes pa yin /
translated: If it is not suitable to appear, then it is not the nature of consciousness. In that case, what is it that is dependent on consciousness?

original: gang la rag lus pa shes pa can gang yin pa de'i rang bzhin snang ba na nyams pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang la rag lus pa shes pa can gang yin pa de'i rang bzhin snang ba na nyams pa ma yin te /
translated: If it is the nature of that which is dependent on consciousness, then it is not destroyed when it appears.

original: sngon po la sogs pa snang ba la rag lus pa'i shes pa can dag bzhin no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa snang ba la rag lus pa'i shes pa can dag bzhin no //
translated: It is like the consciousness that is dependent on the appearance of blue, etc.

original: de la don de nye ba gang yin /
analyzed: de la don de nye ba gang yin /
translated: What is the proximity of that object?

original: gang gis de la bdag med pa'i ngo bor rtogs par 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: gang gis de la bdag med pa'i ngo bor rtogs par 'gyur ba na /
translated: By what is it realized to have the nature of selflessness?

original: bdag nyid so sor nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: bdag nyid so sor nye bar gnas so //
translated: It is the self that is present.

original: de ltar na ni shin tu thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na ni shin tu thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would follow that it is utterly absurd.

original: gal te rtogs par 'gyur ba de dag gi nye bar len pa can yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rtogs par 'gyur ba de dag gi nye bar len pa can yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is the appropriator of that which is realized,

original: nye bar len pa'i don 'di gang yin /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i don 'di gang yin /
translated: what is the meaning of appropriation?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the nature of cause and effect,

original: khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because we do not accept that.

original: khas len na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag phan tshun rtogs pa nye bar 'jog pa can dag ma yin no //
analyzed: khas len na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag phan tshun rtogs pa nye bar 'jog pa can dag ma yin no //
translated: Even if we did accept it, cause and effect would not be mutually dependent.

original: gal te shes pa nyid kyi de med na mi 'byung ba nye ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te shes pa nyid kyi de med na mi 'byung ba nye ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the cognition itself is the non-arising of that which is absent,

original: de nyid rag lus pa med pa med par rigs pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de nyid rag lus pa med pa med par rigs pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: haven‚Äôt we already said that it is not logical for that which is independent to be absent?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu ma yin pa dag la ni rag lus pa cung zad kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba yang bshad zin to //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu ma yin pa dag la ni rag lus pa cung zad kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba yang bshad zin to //
translated: And we have already explained that that which is not a cause and effect is not dependent on anything.

original: gang rtogs pa med na mi 'byung ba'i shes pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba 'di'i shes pa yang yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gang rtogs pa med na mi 'byung ba'i shes pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba 'di'i shes pa yang yod par 'gyur na /
translated: If there were any cognition that did not arise in the absence of that, then that cognition would exist.
