original: slob dpon bdag nyid kyis rigs pa can gyi lhag ma dang ldan pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i 'khrul par bstan pa na /
analyzed: slob dpon bdag nyid kyis rigs pa can gyi lhag ma dang ldan pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i 'khrul par bstan pa na /
translated: When the master himself taught the error of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya‚Äôs inference that possesses a remainder,

original: rjes su dpag pa de 'dra ba bsal ba yin no //üîΩdper na 'bras bu rnams kyi ngo bo mtshungs pa can nyid kyis ro mtshungs pa grub pa bzhin dang / snod gcig gi nad du chud pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa de 'dra ba bsal ba yin no // dper na 'bras bu rnams kyi ngo bo mtshungs pa can nyid kyis ro mtshungs pa grub pa bzhin dang / snod gcig gi nad du chud pa'i phyir /
translated: he refuted such an inference.üîΩFor example, it is like the proof that the taste is the same because the entities of the fruits are the same and it is like the proof that the uncooked rice is cooked because it is cooked in a single pot.

original: mthong ba dang 'dra bar 'bras bu ma mthong ba tshos pa grub pa bzhin no zhes bya ba sgrub par byed pa ma yin par gsungs so //
analyzed: mthong ba dang 'dra bar 'bras bu ma mthong ba tshos pa grub pa bzhin no zhes bya ba sgrub par byed pa ma yin par gsungs so //
translated: He said that such are not proofs.

original: de sgrub par byed pa nyid ma yin pa'i rigs pa yang sngar bshad zin te /üîΩlung gi mtshan nyid 'di kho bo cag gis de ni dpyod par nus pa can gyi yul thams cad bdag nyid ji lta ba @364a * //üîΩbzhin du tshad mas sgrub pa dang dgag pa rnam par dag pa yin na sgra rnams kyi med na mi 'byung ba nyid med na yang /
analyzed: de sgrub par byed pa nyid ma yin pa'i rigs pa yang sngar bshad zin te / lung gi mtshan nyid 'di kho bo cag gis de ni dpyod par nus pa can gyi yul thams cad bdag nyid ji lta ba @364a * // bzhin du tshad mas sgrub pa dang dgag pa rnam par dag pa yin na sgra rnams kyi med na mi 'byung ba nyid med na yang /
translated: The reasoning that does not establish that has already been explained.üîΩThe definition of scripture is this: it is a pure means of establishing or refuting all objects that are capable of being analyzed, just as they are, by means of valid cognition.

original: don rnams la the tshom za'i 'jug pa rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: don rnams la the tshom za'i 'jug pa rigs pa yin te /
translated: Even if the invariable relation between words and their referents does not exist, it is reasonable to doubt the referents of words.

original: de la 'ga' zhig gi tshe mi slu ba srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de la 'ga' zhig gi tshe mi slu ba srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: Because it is possible that sometimes they are nondeceptive.

original: gzhan du skyes bu tshad ma mthong ba dang 'gal ba can gyi rtogs pa ni med do //
analyzed: gzhan du skyes bu tshad ma mthong ba dang 'gal ba can gyi rtogs pa ni med do //
translated: Otherwise, there would be no understanding that contradicts the perception of a valid person.

original: tha mal pa'i yul me grang ba bzlog par nus pa rjod par byed pa bden pa'i don can dmigs nas bstan bcos thams cad bden pa'i don can yul yongs su gcod par nus pa yang tshad ma dang 'gal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tha mal pa'i yul me grang ba bzlog par nus pa rjod par byed pa bden pa'i don can dmigs nas bstan bcos thams cad bden pa'i don can yul yongs su gcod par nus pa yang tshad ma dang 'gal ba'i phyir /
translated: Having observed the expression of a true object that is capable of refuting the ordinary object, fire that is cold, all treatises that are capable of ascertaining the object with a true object are contradicted by valid cognition.

original: ches rigs pa dang ldan pa yang ma yin par smra ba gang yin pa /
analyzed: ches rigs pa dang ldan pa yang ma yin par smra ba gang yin pa /
translated: It is not at all reasonable.üîΩWithout clearing away contradictions,

original: des ni 'gal ba ma bsal dang // bstan bcos don ni ma bstan par //
analyzed: des ni 'gal ba ma bsal dang // bstan bcos don ni ma bstan par //
translated: without teaching the meaning of the treatise,üîΩhe says that the person is permanent, an agent,

original: skyes bu rtag pa byed po dang // dngos rnams rtag dang dbang po 'das //
analyzed: skyes bu rtag pa byed po dang // dngos rnams rtag dang dbang po 'das //
translated: that things are permanent, and that the senses are past objects.

original: dbang pos gzung bya dang dngos rnams //
analyzed: dbang pos gzung bya dang dngos rnams //
translated: Things are objects apprehended by the senses.üîΩHe says that the destruction of things

original: rgyu dang dngos 'jig 'gal ba dang // tshad ma gnyis kyi spyod yul ni //
analyzed: rgyu dang dngos 'jig 'gal ba dang // tshad ma gnyis kyi spyod yul ni //
translated: is contradictory to the objects of the two valid cognitions.üîΩHe says that the objects of the two valid cognitionsüîΩare either eliminated or

original: rnam pa bsal ba gzhan dag gam //
analyzed: rnam pa bsal ba gzhan dag gam //
translated: are other.üîΩHe says that inference depends on scripture

original: lung la ltos pa'i rjes dpag dang // 'gal ba dag ni rjod byed pa //
analyzed: lung la ltos pa'i rjes dpag dang // 'gal ba dag ni rjod byed pa //
translated: and that contradictions are stated.

original: bden pa'i don zhes khas len pa //
analyzed: bden pa'i don zhes khas len pa //
translated: He accepts the meaning of truth

original: g-yem ma mu cor gyis rgyal bzhin //
analyzed: g-yem ma mu cor gyis rgyal bzhin //
translated: as if a whore were to speak with authority.

original: skyes bu'i ngo bo snga phyi 'pho ba dang len pa med pa can 'phrod pa 'du ba can gyi rgyu dang / byin gyis brlabs pa'i ngo bo la sogs pas las dang 'bras bu rnams kyi rim bzhin du byed pa po dang za ba po dngos po 'ga' zhig rtag pa nyid de skad cig ma ma yin pa ni dngos po'i chos las 'das pa nyid kyi phyir mi rigs
analyzed: skyes bu'i ngo bo snga phyi 'pho ba dang len pa med pa can 'phrod pa 'du ba can gyi rgyu dang / byin gyis brlabs pa'i ngo bo la sogs pas las dang 'bras bu rnams kyi rim bzhin du byed pa po dang za ba po dngos po 'ga' zhig rtag pa nyid de skad cig ma ma yin pa ni dngos po'i chos las 'das pa nyid kyi phyir mi rigs
translated: The essence of a person is not something that is transferred from a previous to a later life, and it is not something that is taken up. It is a cause that is present and connected. It is the essence of an empowerment. In this way, it is a permanent thing that is the agent and the experiencer of actions and results. It is not something that is momentary. It is not reasonable to say that it is a thing because it transcends the qualities of being a thing.üîΩIt is also unreasonable to say that universals and so on are direct perceptions, that things arise, endure, and are destroyed,

original: pa dang / spyi la sogs pa mngon sum ma yin pa mngon sum pa dag yin pa dang / dngos po rnams skye ba dang gnas pa dang / 'jig pa 'gal te /
analyzed: pa dang / spyi la sogs pa mngon sum ma yin pa mngon sum pa dag yin pa dang / dngos po rnams skye ba dang gnas pa dang / 'jig pa 'gal te /
translated: and that things are both permanent and impermanent.

original: khyad par du byar med pa can sngar byed pa po ma yin pa gzhan la ltos nas skyed pa po nyid dang grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyad par du byar med pa can sngar byed pa po ma yin pa gzhan la ltos nas skyed pa po nyid dang grub pa'i phyir /
translated: It is unreasonable to say that things are permanent because they are not something that can be distinguished as being different from what they were before. They are not something that is produced in dependence on something else. They are not something that is established as a producer.

original: 'bras bu'i ngo bo can ma yin pa rten gyi dbang gis gnas pa dang / rgyu las 'jig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa ngag gis rab tu grags pa las phyin ci log pa can sgrub par byed pa can gzhan dang /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i ngo bo can ma yin pa rten gyi dbang gis gnas pa dang / rgyu las 'jig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa ngag gis rab tu grags pa las phyin ci log pa can sgrub par byed pa can gzhan dang /
translated: The non-entity of the effect, which is said to abide by the power of the basis and to be destroyed by the cause, and so on, and the proof of the opposite of what is well known in terms of direct perception and inference, and so on,

original: me la sbyin sreg la sogs pas sdig pa sbyong bar nus pa nyid la sogs par lung la brten pa'i rjes su dpag pas gnod pa rig byed kyis smras pa de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes mang du bstan zin to //
analyzed: me la sbyin sreg la sogs pas sdig pa sbyong bar nus pa nyid la sogs par lung la brten pa'i rjes su dpag pas gnod pa rig byed kyis smras pa de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes mang du bstan zin to //
translated: and the refutation by inference based on scripture of the ability to purify evil through fire offerings and so on, as stated in the Vedas, is not reasonable. This has been explained many times.

original: de skad du smra ba'i rig byed de'i bstan bcos kyi lugs thams cad la tshad ma dang 'gal ba ma bsams pa dang / bstan bcos kyi 'brel pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i thabs dang / skyes bu'i don rjod par byed pa ma bstan @364b par ngo //
analyzed: de skad du smra ba'i rig byed de'i bstan bcos kyi lugs thams cad la tshad ma dang 'gal ba ma bsams pa dang / bstan bcos kyi 'brel pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i thabs dang / skyes bu'i don rjod par byed pa ma bstan @364b par ngo //
translated: All the systems of treatises of the Vedas, which speak in this way, are contradicted by valid cognition, and the connection of the treatises, the concordant methods, and the expression of the purpose of the person are not taught.

original: shin tu rab tu grags pa'i yul bden pa brjod pa tsam gyis shes rab kyis rtogs par dka' ba'i thibs po la nyes pa med pa nyid bsgrub par 'dod pas /
analyzed: shin tu rab tu grags pa'i yul bden pa brjod pa tsam gyis shes rab kyis rtogs par dka' ba'i thibs po la nyes pa med pa nyid bsgrub par 'dod pas /
translated: In a very well known place, it is not a fault to have to prove the absence of fault in the darkness that is difficult to understand with wisdom by just the statement of the truth of the object.

original: g-yem ma mu cor gyis kyang rgyal ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: g-yem ma mu cor gyis kyang rgyal ba lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the case of the adulteress who is a chatterbox.

original: g-yem ma 'ga' zhig kyang bdag nyid kyi bdag pos log par zhugs pa'i gnas mthong nas klan ka tshol ba de la /
analyzed: g-yem ma 'ga' zhig kyang bdag nyid kyi bdag pos log par zhugs pa'i gnas mthong nas klan ka tshol ba de la /
translated: When a certain adulteress sees her husband coming home, she looks for a way to deceive him.

original: ma'i chos bzhin gyi chung mas yid ches pa med par bdag gi mig gi chu'i chu bur dag gi ming can gyis yid chos par byed pa'i skyes bu phyin ci log la ltos shing /
analyzed: ma'i chos bzhin gyi chung mas yid ches pa med par bdag gi mig gi chu'i chu bur dag gi ming can gyis yid chos par byed pa'i skyes bu phyin ci log la ltos shing /
translated: Her husband, like a mother‚Äôs brother, does not believe her. He says, ‚ÄúLook at the man who makes me believe with the tears from my wife‚Äôs eyes, which are like bubbles in water.

original: grong pa rgan po mig long ba shing skyed par byed pa des don du gnyer du zin kyang 'brel pa ma byas na /
analyzed: grong pa rgan po mig long ba shing skyed par byed pa des don du gnyer du zin kyang 'brel pa ma byas na /
translated: An old man of the town, blind, and planting trees, though he tries, does not make a connection.

original: gzugs dang yon tan la rjes su chags pas blon po mchog gi khye'u dang / 'dod pa spyod par byed ces lan du zer ro lo //
analyzed: gzugs dang yon tan la rjes su chags pas blon po mchog gi khye'u dang / 'dod pa spyod par byed ces lan du zer ro lo //
translated: The son of the chief minister, attached to form and qualities, says in reply, ‚ÄòShe is practicing desire.‚Äô

original: me ni grang ba'i gnyen po'i tshig gis tshad ma dang 'gal bar mthong ba can /
analyzed: me ni grang ba'i gnyen po'i tshig gis tshad ma dang 'gal bar mthong ba can /
translated: Fire is seen to contradict the word ‚Äúcold‚Äù as an antidote.

original: shin tu lkog tu gyur pa la mi slu bar rjes su dpag pa de ni de lta bu'i rigs can yin no //
analyzed: shin tu lkog tu gyur pa la mi slu bar rjes su dpag pa de ni de lta bu'i rigs can yin no //
translated: Inference, which is non-deceptive with regard to what is extremely hidden, is of that type.

original: gal te de ltar tshad grub na //
analyzed: gal te de ltar tshad grub na //
translated: If it is established as valid cognition,

original: ci ste 'dir ni tshad min ci //
analyzed: ci ste 'dir ni tshad min ci //
translated: why is it not valid here?

original: skyes bu mang du smra ba la //
analyzed: skyes bu mang du smra ba la //
translated: Among many people who speak,

original: bden don can gcig yod med min //
analyzed: bden don can gcig yod med min //
translated: there is no absence of one who speaks the truth.

original: ji ltar 'di shin tu bden par brjod pa shin tu dka' ba de bzhin du shin tu bden pa ma yin pa brjod pa yang ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di shin tu bden par brjod pa shin tu dka' ba de bzhin du shin tu bden pa ma yin pa brjod pa yang ngo //
translated: Just as it is very difficult to speak the truth, so it is also to speak what is not true.

original: de la tshig gcig rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis mi slu bas na de'i tshig gi tshogs lhag ma de ltar 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: de la tshig gcig rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis mi slu bas na de'i tshig gi tshogs lhag ma de ltar 'gyur na ni /
translated: If one word of that person is non-deceptive in some way, then the rest of his words would be like that.

original: skyes bu 'ga' zhig kyang yid ches pa ma yin par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩgzhan yang / 'chad pa po la sgra gnas pas //
analyzed: skyes bu 'ga' zhig kyang yid ches pa ma yin par mi 'gyur ro // gzhan yang / 'chad pa po la sgra gnas pas //
translated: No one would be distrustful of him.üîΩMoreover,

original: 'di dngos rang bzhin man 'bras min //
analyzed: 'di dngos rang bzhin man 'bras min //
translated: the speaker does not exist by the nature of sound.

original: de las rnam par bzlog pa yis //
analyzed: de las rnam par bzlog pa yis //
translated: By the opposite of that,

original: 'khrul pa med pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pa yod ma yin //
translated: There is no such thing as non-error.

original: re zhig tshig de brjod par bya ba dag gi rang bzhin ma yin zhing /
analyzed: re zhig tshig de brjod par bya ba dag gi rang bzhin ma yin zhing /
translated: To begin with, that word is not the nature of the things to be expressed.

original: de dag gi 'bras bu yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the effect of those things,

original: de med du zin kyang 'chad pa po brjod par 'dod pa tsam gyis yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med du zin kyang 'chad pa po brjod par 'dod pa tsam gyis yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even if it does not exist, the speaker can express it merely by the desire to express it.

original: gzhan 'ga' zhig kyang 'khrul pa med pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan 'ga' zhig kyang 'khrul pa med pa can ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there any other that is non-erroneous,

original: 'khrul pa yin na yang de las rnam pa gzhan du yang de srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa yin na yang de las rnam pa gzhan du yang de srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even if it is erroneous, it is possible that it is different from that.

original: de yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because that exists,

original: de rtogs par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de rtogs par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not reasonable to understand it.üîΩIf the engagement of the expressions

original: gal te rjod byed rnams kyi 'jug / brjod bya mthong ba yin zhe na //
analyzed: gal te rjod byed rnams kyi 'jug / brjod bya mthong ba yin zhe na //
translated: is due to seeing the expressed,

original: de ltar na ni 'gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar na ni 'gyur na /
translated: then in that case,

original: tshig gi 'bras bu nyid yin te //
analyzed: tshig gi 'bras bu nyid yin te //
translated: the effect of the words would be the expressed,

original: rjod par byed pa ni brjod bya mthong bas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa ni brjod bya mthong bas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the expression engages due to seeing the expressed.

original: de ltar yin na ni /
analyzed: de ltar yin na ni /
translated: If that were the case,

original: phan tshun dag ni 'gal bar don //
analyzed: phan tshun dag ni 'gal bar don //
translated: the meanings would be mutually contradictory.

original: de ni gcig la ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni gcig la ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: How could that be in one thing?

original: gal te brjod bya'i dngos po med par sgra mi 'jug go zhes bya ba'i nges pa de ni brjod pa tha dad pa dag yod na /üîΩdngos po gcig la 'gal ba ni rang bzhin @365a * //
analyzed: gal te brjod bya'i dngos po med par sgra mi 'jug go zhes bya ba'i nges pa de ni brjod pa tha dad pa dag yod na / dngos po gcig la 'gal ba ni rang bzhin @365a * //
translated: then, when there are different expressions,üîΩthere would be no contradiction in one thing.

original: nye bar sbyor bas 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩsgra gcig rnam grangs med pa rtag pa dang mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye bar sbyor bas 'jug par mi 'gyur ro // sgra gcig rnam grangs med pa rtag pa dang mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is not possible to apply a word to a thing without a basis in reality,

original: zhes bya ba 'di ni srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ni srid pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not possible for one word to be both permanent and impermanent without alternatives.
